summary: Edward M Evans is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He appears in multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from 1977 to 1978. These documents list his name, position, annual salary, and gross pay for various accounting periods. The consistent appearance of his name across these documents indicates his sustained involvement with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Edward M Evans' significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, contributing to the administrative and operational functions of the committee during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of his role is not detailed in the provided summaries, his presence on payroll and certification reports confirms his involvement in the HSCA's activities.
